Package com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions

Class SchurDecomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​?,​?,​?,​?,​U,​?>,​U extends VectorMixin<U,​?,​?,​?,​?,​T,​?,​?>>

java.lang.Object
com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions.SchurDecomposition<T,​U>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of.
U - Vector type for columns of the matrices of the Schur decomposition.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Decomposition<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComplexSchurDecomposition, RealSchurDecomposition
public abstract class SchurDecomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​?,​?,​?,​?,​U,​?>,​U extends VectorMixin<U,​?,​?,​?,​?,​T,​?,​?>> extends Object implements Decomposition<T>

This abstract class specifies methods for computing the Schur decomposition of a square matrix. That is, decompose a square matrix A into A=UTU<sup>H</sup> where U is a unitary matrix whose columns are the eigenvectors of A and T is an upper triangular matrix in Schur form whose diagonal entries are the eigenvalues of A, corresponding to the columns of U, repeated per their multiplicity.

Note, even if a matrix has only real entries, both U and T may contain complex values.

  • Field Details

    • TOL

      protected static final double TOL

    • MIN_DEFAULT_ITERATIONS

      protected static final int MIN_DEFAULT_ITERATIONS
      The minimum number of iterations to perform by default in the QR algorithm if it has not converged. Specifically, the QR algorithm will run for max(MIN_ITERATIONS, maxIterations) iteration or until the QR algorithm converges, whichever comes first.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • computeU

      protected final boolean computeU
      Flag which indicates if the unitary U should be computed in the decomposition.

    • U

    • hess

      protected HessenburgDecomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​?,​?,​?,​?,​U,​?>,​U extends VectorMixin<U,​?,​?,​?,​?,​T,​?,​?>> hess
      Decomposer to compute the Hessenburg matrix similar to the source matrix. This Hessenburg matrix will be the actual matrix that the Schur decomposition is computed for.

  • Constructor Details

    • SchurDecomposition

      protected SchurDecomposition()
      Creates a decomposer to compute the Schur decomposition.

    • SchurDecomposition

      protected SchurDecomposition​(boolean computeU)
      Creates a decomposer to compute the Schur decomposition which will run for at most maxIterations iterations.
      Parameters:
      computeU - A flag which indicates if the unitary matrix Q should be computed.
      - If true, the Q matrix will be computed. - If false, the Q matrix will not be computed. If it is not needed, this may provide a performance improvement.

  • Method Details

    • shiftedExplicitQR

      protected abstract void shiftedExplicitQR​(T H)
      Computes the Schur decomposition for a complex matrix using a shifted QR algorithm where the QR decomposition is computed explicitly.
      Parameters:
      H - The matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of. Assumed to be in upper Hessenburg form.

    • doubleShiftImplicitQR

      protected abstract void doubleShiftImplicitQR​(T H)
      Computes the Schur decomposition of a matrix using Francis' algorithm (i.e. The implicit double shifted QR algorithm).
      Parameters:
      H - The matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of. Assumed to be in upper Hessenburg form.

    • applyQR

      protected final void applyQR​(T src)
      Computes the Schur decomposition of the src matrix using a variant of the QR algorithm.
      Parameters:
      src - The matrix to decompose.

    • real2ComplexSchur

      public static CMatrix real2ComplexSchur​(Matrix realT)
      Converts a matrix decomposed into a real Schur form to a complex Schur form. Note, this will not update the U matrix from the Schur decomposition. See real2ComplexSchur(Matrix, Matrix) to also update the U matrix.
      Parameters:
      realT - The real Schur matrix T in the Schur decomposition {@code A=UTU<sup>T</sup>}
      Returns:
      A matrix in complex Schur from corresponding to realT.
      See Also:
      real2ComplexSchur(Matrix, Matrix)

    • real2ComplexSchur

      public static CMatrix[] real2ComplexSchur​(Matrix realT, Matrix realU)
      Converts a matrix decomposed into a real Schur form to a complex Schur form.
      Parameters:
      realT - The real Schur matrix T in the Schur decomposition {@code A=UTU<sup>T</sup>}
      realU - The orthogonal matrix U in the Schur decomposition A=UTU<sup>T</sup>. Can be null.
      Returns:
      An array of complex matrices corresponding to the complex Schur form of the two matrices realT and realU in order.
      See Also:
      real2ComplexSchur(Matrix)

    • deflateT

      static void deflateT​(CMatrix T, CMatrix U, int m)
      Deflates a 2x2 block of the T matrix from the Schur decomposition and accumulates similarity transformations used in deflation in the U matrix of the Schur decomposition.
      Parameters:
      T - The T matrix from the Schur decomposition.
      U - The U matrix of the Schur decomposition.
      m - Row and column index of the lower right entry of the 2x2 block to deflate in T.

    • notConverged

      protected static boolean notConverged​(CMatrix T, int m)
      Checks if an entry along the first sub-diagonal of the T matrix in the Schur decomposition has converged to zero within machine precision. A value is considered to be converged if it is small relative to the two values on the diagonal of the T matrix immediately next to the value of interest. That is, a value at index (m, m-1) is considered converged if it is less in absolute value than the absolute sum of the entries at (m-1, m-1) and (m, m) times machine epsilon (i.e. Math.ulp(1.0d)).
      Parameters:
      T - The T Matrix in the Schur decomposition.
      m - Row index of the value of interest within the T matrix.
      Returns:
      True if the specified entry has not converged. That is, the entry in the T matrix is greater than (in absolute value) machine precision (i.e. Math.ulp(1.0)) times the absolute sum of the entries along the block 2x2 matrix on the diagonal of T containing the entry. Otherwise, returns false.

    • notConverged

      protected static boolean notConverged​(Matrix T, int m)
      Checks if an entry along the first sub-diagonal of the T matrix in the Schur decomposition has converged to zero within machine precision. A value is considered to be converged if it is small relative to the two values on the diagonal of the T matrix immediately next to the value of interest. That is, a value at index (m, m-1) is considered converged if it is less in absolute value than the absolute sum of the entries at (m-1, m-1) and (m, m) times machine epsilon (i.e. Math.ulp(1.0d)).
      Parameters:
      T - The T Matrix in the Schur decomposition.
      m - Row index of the value of interest within the T matrix.
      Returns:
      True if the specified entry has not converged. That is, the entry in the T matrix is greater than (in absolute value) machine precision (i.e. Math.ulp(1.0)) times the absolute sum of the entries along the block 2x2 matrix on the diagonal of T containing the entry. Otherwise, returns false.
